UnitType.Quote: 'Who knows what treasures this broken world holds?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Good day to you friend. Shall we agree, you need my blade; I need your coin. %d gildar sounds a fair price, yes?
UnitType.Backstory: Klunni the clown? No, who has told you this? Klunni is not clumsy. Klunni takes risks; Klunni goes forth boldy where others fear to step. The lords of old, they were clever, they protected their treasure well, but Klunni does not fear to explore their tombs, their temples. Klunni will share the treasure he finds with you, my friend, if you are bold enough to hire him in your service. If not - it is a wide world, and Klunni will find another sovereign to pay his fee!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Kulan is the leader of a great Fallen empire that survived the Cataclysm, and a channeler of dark magics. Some say that he is neither Man or Fallen but a hybrid. And some go further and say that he was not born but spawned by Morrigan the Damned, within the caverns of lost Calebethon.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You do not know who - or what - you are.
Your earliest memories are of Calebethon, and the great laboratories of Morrigan the Mad, deep in the caverns of this world. There are some who say you were made there, that you are not truly Fallen, as you appear, but a creature forged of equal parts man, and Urxen warrior. For centuries, you lived in that darkness, apprenticed to the mad Emperor, serving as his assistant in all matters of necromancy and science.
When Morrigan died, you made your way to Cyndrum, where you served the Lady Umber until she perished in the cataclysm. Now you seek to raise an Empire of your own.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I feel no pain.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You seek warriors? You seek fighters for your cause? Kunsetti Kava is greatest warrior you will find. %d gildar, you give, Kunsetti will join you.
UnitType.Backstory: Two lives, Kunsetti has lived. This is true. In service of the great Abaja, last of the Adorri tribe, I was killed. Abaja himself brought me back to life, a second time. Abaja used on me the Ring of the Phoenix - one moment, Kunsetti Kava is bleeding in the desert sand, and the next... he is back in Abaja's palace. This is how the Ring works. But only once, Abaja told me, and set me free from his service, to find another to fight for. Now Kunsetti Kava has found you!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The wasteland is no place for a skilled merchant like myself.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Greetings, friend. I am Leadanna, of the House Merdici. A merchant, yes, but a skilled adminstrator as well. %d gildar, and I am yours to command.
UnitType.Backstory: May I be honest with you, my friend? I can fight, yes, I have studied the ways of the staff, but it is with numbers - with coin - that I am most comfortable. Always it has been this way, since I was a little girl. I was quite sickly, you see - quite thin, quite frail. Much time did I spend indoors, while my brothers played, but this was for good, in the end, I learned from my uncle Carando the skills of the trader. And so it was that when my aunt passed, I was the one chosen to accompany Carando and his caravans across the wastes. That is why I survived, for when the Black Summer came... I was fortunate, I suppose. I am the last of the Merdici, though - when I pass from the world, the name passes with me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The key to our salvation exists in the arcane arts.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Peace to you, friend. Liniad is my name, Liniad of the Iron Tribes. I'll hire my staff, and my knowledge of the old ways, to your service, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I was born a miner's daughter, friend. Ten children in my family, the only girl... I never thought to see much of this world growing up, but what happened... I was cooking dinner for my father and brothers, they were in the mines, and came a stranger to our door. Had the whitest skin I'd ever seen in my life. Albino, was my guess, though a little darker, he could have been a grayskin. Friendly enough, though, and he was hurt, I could see that, no danger to me... so I gave him food - my father gave him shelter that night, and he was grateful. Kozma, that was the man's name. Strange name, aye. Well the next morning, after the others had gone off to the mines... this man Kozma reached into his pack, see, and handed me a book. First book I'd ever seen in my life. Thick as a loaf of bread, heavy as a brick... written in all these different languages, as it turns out, though of course I couldn't read a word of any of it, back then. "Dying I am, sweet girl. Sweet Linnaid," the man says to me, in this strange accent he had, one I never heard before, or since. "And I have great treasure," he says. "I hoped to bring book to Queen in the West, but Meerdul..." He made a noise then, like he was in pain, and shook his head. "Now I must leave book with you," he says. "Make use of it. Use of it for good. Promise me." Well, I had no idea what he meant by half of that - Queen in the West? Meerdul? - but I promised him. And we spent that day... he read me parts of the book. Taught me some things, and the next day... Kozma, he died. We buried him high up in the hills - dug the grave myself. Well, I kept my promise to him, or tried to, taught myself to read with the help of a friend of mine, at least the parts of the book that were in common tongue, and by and by... well, you see once you learn how big the world is, you just have to go out and see it, don't you? And that's what happened to me. I had to leave the village. Not as if my father understood, but maybe one day... I can go back. I'd like to go back, once I've done as Kozma asked. Used what's in the book for good. That's my aim.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'None should go digging in the past.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar - that seems to me a fair price for my services, but of course, we can bargain if you wish.
UnitType.Backstory: Yes, I am expert with the staff. I was taught by a man named Yoska, a Padar of the old ways. There was in my village a ruin, a temple of Morain, who was the most powerful of the Five, and this was tended by Yoska. And I was a little girl, curious as all children are, and I saw him fight these brigands away from the temple and its relics - five of them, against one old man, swords and armor against a staff, and he beat them all down. He could have killed them, but that is not the way of the Padars. They worship life, you see. And so from him I learned the staff, and before you ask - the way of the Padars, that is not my way. I have killed. Life is war, is it not? This I have learned from my family, no we are not warriors, we are merchants, but in commerce, my mother has taught me, there are winners and losers as well, and it is best always to be on the winning side. I am expert in the ways of money as well, and this knowledge too you will have if you hire my services..

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If I knew back then, what I know right now...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am Listrid of Ravdale. In the last year of the Great Games, I was champion of the Free Woman's Tourney. Hire my services for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I see it burn in your eyes, friend. The warrior's fire; great glory awaits you. Let Listrid be part of your army; I will vanquish your enemies, and help you tame the wastes once more.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'All I need is food to eat and pockets to pick.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Pay me %d gildar and point me towards your enemies.
UnitType.Backstory: I was a thief, yes; I am a soldier by trade now. A fighter. I do not apologize for my past; I was an orphan, I did what was necessary to survive. Some good came of it as well; there are none who can work in the darkness, in close quarters, as skillfully as I. But now I seek fellowship, security, a good wage for an honest day's service.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'll bring forth life, where there was none before.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Fair weather to you, friend. I am Lochar of the Iron tribes. These are dangerous lands you've come upon - for %d gildar, I'll put my knowledge to your service.
UnitType.Backstory: A question for you, friend. Do you believe in the old gods? The Elemental Lords? Ah, it's none of my business, I suppose, what you believe. But you best be prepared for anything, if you're going out in the wastelands there. I could tell you stories... turn your hair white. And it's not just the Lords you'll be meeting out there - the Five. There are the lesser Elementals too... things of the earth, and the air. This staff here, it can handle them well enough, and it's at your service. For the right price, as I said.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Life is cruel, but not nearly as much as I.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hire me. %d gildar. I will protect you and yours.
UnitType.Backstory: This hammer speaks for me. I am not good with words. Brillda, she who was my wife, she was good with words. She was good with my sons. But they are dead now, so the need for words is gone.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: To burn, to blow, to burrow and flow.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Fellow traveler, fellow seeker, be still a moment. The spirits of this world, they are calling. You do not hear them? Ah... for a mere %d gildar, I will tell you what they say.
UnitType.Backstory: It is the Anthuanii of which I speak - the ancient ones. They live in the great shards - in the dark of night, in the still of the dreamtime, they whisper their desires. I heard them only after the Transformation, after the return of the Oracle. I fled from my home to quiet their voices, but they followed me across the wastes. Take me into your service, and I will help you learn their secrets, help you learn to master their magicks.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The magic I seek may prove my undoing.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will join with your company, for a fee of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: We stand on the verge of catastrophe, my friend. The grayskins seek to extend their dominion over the entirety of this world, and we - all the tribes of man, all the countries, all the races, - must band together to stop them. We must pool the knowledge we have in this fight, yes, even that which the scholars of ages past called the black arts. For surely our foes will use those weapons themselves.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Why have I been forsaken?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Shalaam, stranger. I am Mazi, last of the Sula. I will join your army for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: In the time before this one, the Sula were the greatest fighters of the Southern tribes. But our lands were drowned in the cataclysm, and then our women stolen by the Quendar. I am the last to carry the spear of Sulandi. Should you hire my service, I ask only this of you, that you break my weapon should I fall in battle. Break my weapon, and burn it, and let none mark my grave, for the Sula belong to the desert.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'People cannot be trusted as a cog or lever can.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Dark times these are, my friend. But for %d gildar I can share with my insights; my thoughts on how best to survive, and even prosper.
UnitType.Backstory: I have made it my life's work to study the lost magicks of Antheros; to rediscover the principles of the great engineers, who built the siege towers of Redstone. I would put these skills to your service, friend, I would build you great machines to help you achieve your goals, should you hire me to your service.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Farming is as much a part of me as my mind and body are.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: It is Miredesi of the Quendar who stands before you, stranger. I offer my staff, my spirit, to your service, for the price of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Dark times are upon us, stranger. The Oracle has risen. The Elemental Lords of old have broken free of their chains, and seek revenge upon all the world. Soon Delin's fire will fill the skies once more, I have foreseen this. The weak will scatter to all corners of the earth; the strong will seek a leader to follow, to guide them through the storms that are to come. A new sovereign to seize Curgen's throne... are you the one, stranger? I cannot see. I cannot tell. But Miredesi is willing to aid you, in your quest, if you will have her.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'With the knowledge of two lifetimes, I will rebuild the world.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I have no wish to walk the wastes alone. I seek a patron to serve, to help me survive. %d gildar will serve as my fee.
UnitType.Backstory: I have much to offer to the one who hires me, for I was raised in the shadow of Odenvell. Before the Oracle rose, before the time of Transformation, many came questing to our village, seeking the treasures of the past, and from them I learned knowledge of all corners of the world. This knowledge can be yours as well, if you meet my price.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To find my brother, by any means necessary.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar is my fee, stranger. For that modest sum, my skills as a warrior are at your beck and call, night and day.
UnitType.Backstory: I have mastery of the mace, and knowledge of the sword. I fought with honor alongside the Azure Knights, during the Revolt. You may rest assured, stranger, that should you pay my fee, you shall have my undivided loyalties. I would ask, however, if you have seen - or had word - of a warrior named Myrol, also a master of the mace. For he is my brother, twin to me, lost now a half-dozen years. Taken captive, he and his troop, by a band of darklings while crossing the Western Wastes. If you have any knowledge of him at all, you would lighten my heart greatly by relaying it.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My people lost faith and suffered for it. Will you make the same mistake?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar will secure my services.
UnitType.Backstory: Do not speak to me of great causes, stranger. I fight for money.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let us rebuild this land together.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'll march under your banner, friend, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Aye, I can handle myself in battle, friend, but it's my skills as a builder that make me worth the coin I ask. In the village I come from - a place called Gairlach, far to the north of here - my family's had charge of the mines since the time of Hosten himself, and my father, may he rest in peace, he taught me the ways of the engineer when I was not much more than a boy. I know my numbers, and my weights and measures as well as any man. When Lord Immerg needed the towers of New Ithul rebuilt, it was me he called on; I was second engineer on the fortress there as well. I ain't afraid of any job, or any man either, for that matter.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I have lost all that I have ever known.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will keep safe what is yours, stranger. For %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: This bow is of the yrilla tree - it was given to me by the peoples of the jungle, by the Drota. Some say they enchant their weapons, but I believe it to be the wood itself... its color, its strength, its flexibility. It is the perfect killing weapon, to me. Most among my people would not think so. The Quendar believe that death is to be dealt face-to-face - that there is honor only in a killing blow given by your hand, to your enemy at close range. This my father believed, but he and my brothers were slaughtered by D'rog spearmen - Trog warriors - who dared not face them in hand-to-hand combat. As all Quendar must, I have mastered the art of unarmed combat. But my preferred weapon - always - is the bow. I fight not for honor. I fight to kill.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The only good beast is the one that pulls the plow, for that beast knows its place!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Halt, stranger. Natilya has offer for you. %d of your gildar, I march with you.
UnitType.Backstory: Wastes are full of dangerous things; pinkskins, grayskins, creatures... great spiders, Natila has killed with her spear. Many of them. She has killed warg many times too - wargs are good eating, yes? You hire Natila, I skin them, cook them for you. Is good to eat heart of the warg, make you strong. I have heard heart of slag is good to eat too... but never has Natila eaten slag. Never has Natila fought slag. Something to look forward to, yes? You and Natila, we kill slag together!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Build coffins, that's all you'll need.'

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am a merchant out of spite, but a damn good one nonetheless.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You seek the throne that once belonged to Curgen? I would aid your cause, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: My qualifications? In battle, I killed two score soldiers, perhaps more. This was when I fought with the Urxen of my tribe. And then... my legion was no more. But I remain despite the efforts ot the enemies of my tribe.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Curiosity kills they say. So do I, for the right price.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: In the arena, I became a master of the sword. You can hire me to your cause for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: My blade comes from the time before this one, friend. It was forged by the great smiths of the Iron tribes. I won it it fighting as a slave; I bested a man in combat, and he offered it to me if I would spare his life. I took it and killed him, for by his behavior he dishonored this fine weapon.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My own flesh and blood left me to rot just to make a quick gildar. Dark times indeed.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You need companions, my friend. You could do worse than Nochd. I know the old roads here. %d gildar buys you my knowledge - my company - my protection.
UnitType.Backstory: My story? I was not always a soldier-at-arms. I was a merchant once - my brother and I were partners. We came from Sigidd-Belzen, a town far from here. A town no longer, not since the transformation. Everything changed then - my brother changed then. Something died inside him - money became his god. He made it seem as if I had stolen from another man - he framed me, and I was jailed, and he took all our money, all the wealth and things we had accumulated, and he left. He left me with nothing. I do not have a brother anymore. Well. I have spoken longer than I intended.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'When only the strongest survive, we will defeat the Fallen.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I intend no harm, my friend. I am simple soldier, yours for the hire, if you wish. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: This is new armor, yes. Has seen only five seasons. But only because old armor was ruined. Burned. A great battle I was in - at the Vasyulka, the wildlands... many were killed. Pink and gray skin fought together, against Ignys, and Anthuanii... we killed them too, but not enough. I have learned new ways to kill now... I can show you. I will show you, if you will hire me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I am quicker than thought.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar is my fee, and a pittance to pay for my services.
UnitType.Backstory: My eye is keen, friend. My speed second to none; I have no peer in the art of the sword. I strike without mercy; without warning. If you do not hire me, you will regret it. That is no threat, no boast, but simply a statement of fact. You may ask any soldier, any mercenary whose path you cross, and they will second these words. They will speak of Norii in hushed tones, and with only the greatest respect.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am Nosmina, of Resoln. I seek to be hired. %d gildar for my service.
UnitType.Backstory: I tell you, you will get a bargain if you hire Nosmina. Before, I have charged double what I ask now, and people paid gladly. But now... I need money. The gildar you give me - I will use it for the root of the calivar - this is an ingredient in a healing salve I require to treat an old injury. It does not affect my fighting, no, but it is not an ordinary wound... a sorcerer... a man called Meerduul... he is responsible. In the village I am from, there was a battle... we drove him from the town, but at a terrible cost... my father was killed. My brother as well. Sometimes when I fight... the scar burns... it reminds me of them. This is a good thing.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'One great find and I can rest my tired feet for good.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You have gold? You need fighters? Then I am your man - %d gildar, or its equal in metals or goods, is my price.
UnitType.Backstory: My given name is Othollo, friend, though when I was a Knight, I was known as the Blue Dagger. After my favorite weapon, though truth be told, I make do with whatever's at hand. A kitchen knife, a thief's dirk, a pickpocket's blade... the dagger I was known for, though... that was Antheran steel. Made in the time before this one, friend, crafted in Malaya itself... hardest metal in the land. Go straight through armor, you use it right. Galain took it from me, when he stripped me of the blue. There was no honor in that action, friend, as there was no honor in the Knights' behavior during the Revolt. Tandis himself would never have taken sides in that war. We serve all of mankind, not just this king or that. That's who I wish to serve now - I'll follow you, long as you understand that. Long as you know I have higher goals.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'In my land, we deal harshly with those who would cheat us.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My skills have a price - %d gildar. My honor does not.
UnitType.Backstory: My people are Quendar - we were born and bred to serve the greatest of the Titans, Curgen of the Dred'nir, and from him and those who followed him we learned... well. I will tell you a story. There was a merchant once, a Krax named Sarrad, of the clan of the same name, who thought himself clever, who thought to cheat me of money that was rightfully mine, and the reason you have never heard of this Sarrad or his clan is because they do not exist anymore. None of them. Not the merchant, nor his brothers, nor his wives, or daughters, or sons. And that is what I and my people learned from Curgen, whose name is undying.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Your gold and your life. Nothing personal.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Poena worries for you, my friend. The path before you is filled with dangerous creatures. It is in your best interest to pay Inbasu a small fee - %d gildar - to smooth your way forward. Yes?
UnitType.Backstory: Long has Poena walked these roads, my friend. Since I was a girl, in the village of Um Kafarei, and my father would send me with a basket of calivar to trade with the Deladda people. It is from the Deladda that I have this axe, which their chieftain tells me came from the time before this one, from the time when great Kir-Tion walked the world.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: The only commodity more valuable than life is gildar.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'm out to prove my worth. For %d gildar I'll prove myself to you.
UnitType.Backstory: My name is Pralius, friend. I was of the Dragonborn, a great legion we were. Strong fighters. We struck as one, in battle. Then came the Black Summer. All was lost then. My wife... what happened to her. She suffered, friend, until I could stand her suffering no more. I did what I had to, but I know this. That was no ordinary plague. It was sorcery - dark sorcery, and I know who was responsible. I will find him, and when I do... you see my sword? The blade is not metal, no. I do not know what it is, exactly, it was fashioned for me... careful, do not touch. It is quite toxic. I shall use it in your service, happily, when the need arises. But know that I shall bury it in the heart of he who is responsible for my wife's death when I find him. But fear not. I have other weapons to put at your disposal.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: There is great delight in suffering, for those that survive it.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: The scorpion's skills can be enlisted in your service for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Fairy tale? Who has told you this? Rahelle's story is no fairy tale, but the simple truth. In the year after the Black Summer, I was forced to cross the deserts of the south alone, on horseback. A day's ride from my home, my mount sickened, and died. I burned in the Sun's fires, and fell into the sands, convinced I had met my end. But the Destiny answered my prayers, and sent to me a thousand scorpions, who bore me upon their backs to the safety of a hermit's cave. Since that day, I have been immune to the scorpion's venom. Since that day, my dagger carries within it the scorpion's sting.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Who knows what treasures this broken world holds?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Greetings, friend. I know you will wish to hire my axe in your service. And what a price I give you - %d gildar, far less than an axeman of my rank was meant to earn.
UnitType.Backstory: I am Ralle, who has once been first sword to the Merdici family. Great merchants, whose treasures I was sworn to protect, as I shall protect you and yours if you hire me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It was I that killed my love, not fate. The blame is mine alone.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar, I would be willing to join you.
UnitType.Backstory: Ah yes, the accent... I am from Montenera, you are right, though I left there when I was very young. There was a man who came to our village, his name was Paoluto... he had heard tell of a kouros, a great library, where the wise men of Atalandra had hidden their greatest treasures... well... I was a young girl, Paoluto was a handsome man, and so... I left with him. We traveled east, and then north, into the wastes, and there we found this kouros, and there... Paoluto died. The great treasures of the past... they have great and powerful guardians. Dangerous guardians. You would do well to keep this in mind, friend, and if you see fit to hire me... I shall surely remind you.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I was saved by magic once and now I yearn to understand how.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hail. I seek coin for my service - %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: It hurts me to speak, stranger - an old wound - so I will be brief. My axe is yours, and I have knowledge of the arcane arts as well that I will put at your service, if you hire me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'You are either a fool, or an extremely talented actor...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I will join your ranks, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I will fight for you, my friend, but know this: I do not suffer fools gladly. I am a soldier, not a diplomat; I have no patience with fancy clothes, and court pageantry.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I can express only my humor and dismay at your level of cognition.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Good day, friend. My name is Roydrik, and have little doubt of your need for my assistance, which I would provide for a mere %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I do not care to know your intentions, friend, or those of any companions that may travel with you. I seek only the opportunity to make use of my great and varied skills; to add to the store of knowledge and experience I have amassed traveling the world. Yes, I will fight for you as well, if you wish, though you would be smarter to utilize my skills elsewhere. If you don't mind my saying so.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My story is now interwoven with yours.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Straavni, my friend. Greetings. I am Ruah. I sense a kindred spirit in you... a spirit bent on ordering the chaos of this world. I would assist you in your quest, for only a small fee. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: These are dangerous lands... death is never far. For a price, Ruah will walk with you, will bring her dagger to bear where it is needed. Death and I, we are becoming good friends. We met here, in this very place, not long ago. In the ravine there, I came upon a man I knew. His name was Kronyu, he was a simple mill worker, only not so simple as it turns out... you see, there had been some killings in my village. Five murders, and there was great fear among my people, for we thought the sorcerer we had driven out - a man named Meerduul - we thought he had returned. But there in the ravine, on this day... I came upon Kronyu, as I said. Kronyu, and a dead woman. He was holding her in his arms, he had one hand around her throat, and in the other... he held a tool he had taken from the mill. He had driven it through her neck, and he was holding her tightly, so she could not scream. Holding her and staring into her eyes, and there was blood everywhere, and he was just... staring. Staring into the face of death. And when it was done, he dropped her to the ground, and turned, and then he saw me. And you would think I would have been scared, I was no warrior then, but I knew somehow... I was safe. And soon after this... Kronyu and I became lovers. We lived together. He worked at the mill, and some days... he would kill. This we never spoke of, but... I began to wonder. I began to dream. Dreams of dark gods and dying men. Dreams of what it might be like to kill someone, myself. And then one night... Kronyu was sleeping. And through my head ran all the questions about what killing felt like, and I thought first of waking him. But I knew he could not tell me what it felt like with words. And so... I took a knife from near the fire. It was covered in blood, from a chicken we had cooked for our dinner. I took that knife, and I lay down next to Kronyu. Very close. He was warm... I could feel his breath going in and out. I felt the beating of his heart; I smelt the cut wood of the mill on his hair. I slipped the knife into him. Up beneath his ribs. He came awake with a start, and saw me, and ... he tried to move away, but I held him close. He tried to talk, but I covered his mouth. I looked into his eyes, and waited, and after a time... It is strange, I know, to speak of such terrible things. But these are terrible times, my friend. Ruah can help you get through them, you will see.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My story is now interwoven with yours.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Halt, stranger. I bid you Straavni - hello, in the language of my people. Are you seeking swords to hire? My services are %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Ruka's story? It is a simple one. Lesson I learned from my father. Make this world a better place. He was Lekktor of Sigedd-Belsen - leader of village elders. A good talker, not so good a fighter. This is why he is dead. When the transformation came... all was chaos. Many fled, my father stayed. Tried to help others. He was killed. Free Riders rescued me. Taught me to fight. I have this sword from them, and I am expert in this use. Hire me. I will show you. I will prove it to you.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let the cowards run, I need only the courageous.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I'll help you, if you wish for %d gildar. Or I fight you - no charge!
UnitType.Backstory: I am making a joke with you, stranger. I fight only for money but I will make a wager with you, Sculla against any champion you choose. I will fight blindfolded. I am without fear, it is how my father raised me. My father was a great soldier in the city of Bruze. When I was a girl I trained with Bruze soldiers to make my father proud. I fight, so his name is not forgotten. Ladmir of Bruze.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Furthering the technology of war will always provide results.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am Serenes of the Quendar, stranger. My race was born to service. For %d gildar, I shall keep you and yours safe.
UnitType.Backstory: Do you know of the Quendar? We were made from man, raised to the side of Curgen himself, and sworn to his service. We are steel, tempered from the moment of birth. We know no fear, we know no mercy, unless it is commanded by the one in whose service we are pledged. When the world cracked, when the walls of Imperium fell, the Quendar stood strong at Curgen's side. When the fire of Delin brought down the wrath of the titans, when rocks fell from the sky like raindrops, it was the Quendar who formed a shield that the women and children of the great city could reach shelter unharmed. For two dozen generations, the family of Sergenes served the masters of the East - but the Titans and their lieutenants are no more, and so I, Sergenes, must seek a sovereign worthy of my loyalty. My trust. I wonder if you, stranger, are that ruler.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'There is an elegance found in ancient devices that I am keen to preserve.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I seek to serve with honor. I seek a sovereign whose interests align with my own, and if you are that leader, my skills are yours to hire, at the price of %d gildar, a sum which I am sure you will agree is more than fair.
UnitType.Backstory: Will you find others more skilled with a staff than myself? Perhaps. Will you find more renowned fighters, or more seasoned tacticians? I am certain you would, if you were to search long and hard enough. What I have to offer is a purity of purpose, friend; an honest heart, a skilled hand, and true devotion to your cause, if I find it worthy. I will tell you that long ago, I was apprenticed to the Azure Knights, intent on joining their ranks myself, though since the time of the Nobles Revolt, the allure of their cause has faded. But the knowledge gained in their service... that burns in my mind still. Knowledge of the Magi's ways... knowledge I will put to the service of a true and well-intentioned leader.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Never underestimate the wisdom of a woman.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hail and well met, friend. I am Shannon of Vurthela. I am a skilled administrator, and require only %d gildar for my services.
UnitType.Backstory: The money is for my village, friend, not me. Vurthela was nearly destroyed some years ago, and we are still rebuilding. I would return - my family lives there still - but I can do more out in the world. I feel an obligation to do more - the Destiny has put us all here to help one another, I believe. And there is so much help that is needed, the world is so broken... I wish to serve. You speak of a desire to unite all of mankind - I share this, for we are all of us sisters and brothers beneath the skin. When I traveled with the Knights - I was of their ranks once, the Azure Knights - I learned this truth, eternal, undying. I hope you share my belief.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar, for my services in battle.
UnitType.Backstory: You have not heard of Shimsher? Forty of the Quendar tribe in one battle did I slay, with my axe. And the next day, twelve more. This was in the Battle of the Fist, where the white sands of the desert turned black with blood.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Do not discard the bent and broken, it can be remade."
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Shalaam, stranger. I am Skuzu. I am a weapon smith. If you will pay me %d gildar, I will make sure the blades of your warriors are never dull.
UnitType.Backstory: It gives me the greatest pleasure to make a fine weapon; in the Shaman's war, I was armorer to Shak Uzman, responsible for the swords and armor of a hundred great warriors. Allow me to assist you in the wars you plan, stranger, and you will not be sorry.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Don't tell me there's no one left to fight.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Ain't met the man yet who could stand up to me in a fight. %d gildar, I'll put my sword in your service.
UnitType.Backstory: I've got the blood of the Aivernach in my veins, on my father's side. But I'd rather swing a hammer than make one, friend. It's my aim to see the world, or what's left of it, in the years I have left to me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I fell into this profession long ago, but it is all I have ever known.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: If you seek to build an empire, you will find my services of great value. %d gildar is my fee, payable in advance.
UnitType.Backstory: I took no schooling; I learned the skills of administration by watching my husband work, by listening to those who served under him discuss his various deeds. When my husband passed... I put a knife through the heart of his second, and took his job for myself. Treat me fairly, and I will work hard for you. Cross me, and you will live to regret it.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: There are monsters in the darkness, but the worst acts of men are done in full view.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Ask not my age, only my price. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I am Quendar - it is not for you to question me. I have walked the darkness of Deocrynesse; I have seen the things that live beneath this world. Let us not waste time conversing; you and I, stranger, we are the dead who walk, awaiting only the hour of reckoning. Let me join you in your battle; let me fight your war, and bring glory to both our names.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: Those who need shelter need only seek me...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Come - let Sulowa's axe sing for you, stranger. %d gildar, and I will march in your army, and cut down your enemies.
UnitType.Backstory: Sulowa has long sought a sovereign to pledge his strength to - a leader who will raise the peoples of the East to glory once more. I think you are that leader, yes? I think you will be Az-Adoras, come again, to make the desert sands bloom, and the great jungles grow once more.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Only those brave enough to rebel can know true freedom.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Pay %d gildar to Svedd, his axe becomes yours.
UnitType.Backstory: Only those brave enough to rebel can know true freedom. These are words of Tarth, who shares them with Svedd, before war comes. Now you and I, friend, we must rebel against all of this world, to make new one.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I am no ordinary fighter, friend - and I sense you are no ordinary traveler. Pay me %d gildar, and I shall gladly join your cause.
UnitType.Backstory: A single name is all we are given, we Urxen. From birth, we are raised as fighters, male and female alike. We are given swords upon our ninth birthday, and on our twelfth, if we have not dishonored them, we may take the name of our tribe as well. I am thus Tann of the Dragonborn. In my nineteenth year, I was raised to command. This was ten years ago; in thefifth year of my command came the Black Summer. That plague took all but a handful of my company, and killed all the elders among the Dragonborn. I myself burned the huts of our village, and now... I am a sellsword, yes. But I am Urxen still. A soldier born and bred. I seek the discipline of an army; I seek a sovereign to follow.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The beauty of antiquity is not lost on me, even when it is hidden to others.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I want to see the world put back together again, friend. I want to see greatness before I die. If you'll have me, I'll join your cause, for the proper price. %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: I was raised in the far mountains, in the shadow of what was Aivern. The great towers, friend, I could see what was left of them outside the window of my hut each night. My brothers and I, we played in those ruins when we were young. They played at war, and I played at building. Now I don't play. Now that building's what I do, friend. Lok Karney, in the near Skarps... I'm the Tearny who saw those tunnels dug right. Now that mine is giving iron to those people once more. Not making 'em rich, no, but at least they're surviving. And I can do better. I can do more. More for you, if you'll have me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: I enjoy battles, when the screams of my enemies join in symphany with those in my mind.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: You seek Curgen's throne? I admire your presumption. For %d gildar, I will aid your cause.
UnitType.Backstory: Look not upon this form, mortal. This form does not matter. Look within my eyes to see whose service your coin buys, for in this form dwells the spirit of dread Thannata, who was summoned from the void between worlds by Morrigan himself. In his name I slit the throats of a thousand men, ripped the hearts from brave warriors as they charged upon the battlefield, tore the limbs from their steeds as they tried to flee. Though my flesh rotted long ago, my spirit survived, and thanks to the Patricide's magicks, it can move - I can move - from form to form. This body will soon pass too, though long before it does it will do your cause good service.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My blade and I are a nightmare from which you'll never wake...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hire Tsomok's sword, stranger, and you will win all the wars of your days. %d gildar is my fee.
UnitType.Backstory: Many battles have I fought in; many foes have I slain. This sword I carry was a gift to my people long, long ago, in the time before this one. It is an enchanted blade; with it, I slew Umana Noress, queen of the Drota. Its point pierced her skin, and turned her heart to ice. With the flat of its blade, I turned the flesh of her daughters to snow, and cast her evil from the world forever.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Great kingdoms require great planning. That's where I come in.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Turin Mafaru's fee is %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A great empire requires great planning, my friend. Turin Mafaru has raised cities from deserts; you would do well to hire me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'This world asks many questions, all of which I will answer in time.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I, Ulfnir, will fight for you. Will teach for you. %d gildar is my price.
UnitType.Backstory: In the arena at Capitar, I learned to wield the axe. In the arena, too, I learned of the Decalon, the ten notebooks Ezmir filled with learning of ages past. Teachings of Aerus Aelmann, of Josryn the Just... these I have studied, and will share with you, if you hire me.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will guard only those who are worthy.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: My sword and my skills are for hire, stranger - %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: It is a unique weapon I offer in your service, stranger. Here - I will show you. You can see, the metal itself... it burns, yes, but it is not consumed. If it touches flesh, though... I myself am immune to it, of course. How the blade was enchanted? No, I cannot say. The weapon was given to me by my father - he was - he is - Galain Gaelsen. The hero of Thela's Peak, yes. A great knight, yes. We no longer speak. It is my service you are buying. Ulrik Gaelsen. I have commanded in battle as well.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Uza is fighter; pay Uza %d gildar, he fights for you.
UnitType.Backstory: Uza's father was great warrior; Uza's mother was Edar. Uza knows fire; Uza knows war. To kill, to burn... these things make Uza happy.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'They say I seek wealth for poor reasons. Is there a good reason?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: For %d gildar I will help grow your settlements.
UnitType.Backstory: I have a banker's training, friend. I have a banker's mind. You may find glory in empire, or in seeking the greater good; I have no interest in those things. They will not help me render assistance to you. I balance profit against loss; risk against reward. In this way will I help you succeed; in this way will I increase my own worth as well.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I prefer numbers to people. Numbers don't lie. Confuse, of course, but they never lie.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar would sway me into your employ, my friend.
UnitType.Backstory: I was apprentice to the House of Lamord, my friend, but now I seek to make my own fortune. I do not brag to tell you I am a master of trade. If you hire me to your cause, I promise you never will be cheated. This kingdom you seek to build, I will pave its roads for you.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: %d gildar buys you my service, friend. For a time, at least.
UnitType.Backstory: Do not misunderstand; I would not betray you, not for all the money in the bank of the Lamord. No, it is simply that I have no desire to tie myself down for long; to a man, or a cause, or a business for that matter. These are the terms under which I offer my services.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'This world has taken much from me. It's time I got something in return!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Do not fear Vasim. I am fighter for hire now. I cost %d gildar - a good deal for you, stranger.
UnitType.Backstory: These are dangerous lands, stranger. Dangerous times. I have seen much... I tell you story. Vasim's story. I am from Bruze - you have heard of it? Well, it does not matter. Bruze is - was - great city. City of survivors. City of fighters. But this world... Titans were dangerous, yes, but more dangerous still... the Anthuanii... yes, these things are real, I have seen them... Bruze was near wildlands, great swamp... the Vassyulka, we call it... these creatures come out of swamp, first only a few, but then more and more, and Vazim's brothers are killed, Vasim's family is killed, whole city is gone... dangerous times, my friend. I have fought these things, and they must be destroyed, as the Titans intended. As Curgen intended. You will see this, Vasim is sure. When you do... Vasim is with you. Vasim and his axe.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Backstory: Once, he was a holy man. A Son of the Dragon; a worshipper of Elementals most primal, powerful creatures. Their warden; their protector. Then Curgen sent the slave armies of the Quendar after Waerloga and his charges; in response, Waerloga took up the Scepter of Tan-La-Ur, and bound the dragons to his will. For seven long, bloody years, he waged war against the armies of Imperium; a war that ended with his defeat, and imprisonment within the darkest of all Curgens dungeons, the Pit of Lost Voices. There are some who say he waits there still, brooding and silent, seeking only the chance to win his escape, and wreak vengeance upon the world.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'There is a distinct beauty that comes with understanding.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Greetings, my friend. Long have I sought a worthy sovereign to follow; for %d gildar, I will pledge my loyalty to you.
UnitType.Backstory: This world in which we live, my friend, it is broken. Do you not feel this way? I have learned so much of the past, so much of what has been lost... I wish to fix things. To make things whole again. I seek a leader, who feels the same.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: "I seek no mercenaries; the Silver Swordsmen and their ilk are unwelcome in the ranks of my army. What I seek are heroes - those who wish to make bettering this world their life's adventure!" These words - uttered at the nadir of the Nobles Revolt, when the armies of Procipinee surrounded Relias and his companions at the foot of Mount Essa - remain the rallying cry for all Altar's soldiers. This is an army of adventurers - many of whom are famous in their own right for the quests they have completed - an army that will sometimes dare the impossible and often achieve it.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: "I seek no mercenaries; the Silver Swordsmen and their ilk are unwelcome in the ranks of my army. What I seek are heroes - those who wish to make bettering this world their life's adventure!" These words - uttered at the nadir of the Nobles Revolt, when the armies of Procipinee surrounded Relias and his companions at the foot of Mount Essa - remain the rallying cry for all Altar's soldiers. This is an army of adventurers - many of whom are famous in their own right for the quests they have completed - an army that will sometimes dare the impossible and often achieve it.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: All who wear the colors of this army, from commander to common foot-soldier, can trace their lineage back to the great kingdoms of the pre-cataclysmic era - to Coriopolis, Zad-Zabril, and even fabled Antheros. The blood of the channelers of old runs in their veins; they know and are unafraid of using this power to aid them in combat, both as shield and sword, in defense and attack. The commander who would engage this army in battle most possess a similar familiarity with the enchanter's art.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: All who wear the colors of this army, from commander to common foot-soldier, can trace their lineage back to the great kingdoms of the pre-cataclysmic era - to Coriopolis, Zad-Zabril, and even fabled Antheros. The blood of the channelers of old runs in their veins; they know and are unafraid of using this power to aid them in combat, both as shield and sword, in defense and attack. The commander who would engage this army in battle most possess a similar familiarity with the enchanter's art.

UnitType.Description: Henchmen level and can use equipment like champions, but don't divide experience.
A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: These are miners by trade; they make cautious soldiers, content to assess a battle's progress from a fortified position, to rely less on tactical skill and more on superior equipment to provide them advantage. Many among them are innately resistant to the channeler's basic spells, a trait inherited from the greatest of their kind, Fierann Ma Tua of the Aivernach.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: These are miners by trade; they make cautious soldiers, content to assess a battle's progress from a fortified position, to rely less on tactical skill and more on superior equipment to provide them advantage. Many among them are innately resistant to the channeler's basic spells, a trait inherited from the greatest of their kind, Fierann Ma Tua of the Aivernach.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: There are no more stalwart defenders than the armies of Kraxis; their ability to establish and protect near-unassailable battlefield positions is well-documented. Recall the siege of Morrania, the last of the great pre-cataclysmic battles between Man and Fallen, where four hundred Krax held off two thousand D'Rog fighters. Some may call them traitors, but the Krax have an unshakeable belief in the righteousness of their cause, and an uncanny ability to persuade others to their side a trait opposing commanders would do well to take note of.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: There are no more stalwart defenders than the armies of Kraxis; their ability to establish and protect near-unassailable battlefield positions is well-documented. Recall the siege of Morrania, the last of the great pre-cataclysmic battles between Man and Fallen, where four hundred Krax held off two thousand D'Rog fighters. Some may call them traitors, but the Krax have an unshakeable belief in the righteousness of their cause, and an uncanny ability to persuade others to their side a trait opposing commanders would do well to take note of.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The armies of Capitar have at their disposal the vast wealth of the great trading houses of old, money that lets them buy not just the best equipment, but the best fighters: mercenaries such as the Silver Swordsmen; archers whose skills rival the ninety-nine of Redstone; war horses bred from the stock of fabled Antheros. This great wealth buys influence in diplomatic councils as well as on the battlefield; a fact the seasoned commander would do well to keep in mind when forging alliances.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: The armies of Capitar have at their disposal the vast wealth of the great trading houses of old, money that lets them buy not just the best equipment, but the best fighters: mercenaries such as the Silver Swordsmen; archers whose skills rival the ninety-nine of Redstone; war horses bred from the stock of fabled Antheros. This great wealth buys influence in diplomatic councils as well as on the battlefield; a fact the seasoned commander would do well to keep in mind when forging alliances.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' These words - spoken by Vergaxa of the Quendar - remain the watchword for the commanders of this army. They will make slaves of any fighter they defeat in battle; they will conscript any banker, baker, or miner whose path they cross. From those slaves they will make soldiers, and from those soldiers, massive armies driven by fear of the lash, and inculcated with the discipline prescribed by Vergaxa centuries earlier.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Discipline is first, second, and third when building an effective fighting force. Little else matters.' UnitType.Description: The least of Magnar society.
UnitType.Backstory: Ages ago, when the legions of Antheros fell to the Quendar, Magnar II enslaved the soldiers of that once-great nation, forcing them to serve in the advance guard of his army. Since that day, the Quendar have made it a practice to not only enslave the conquered masses of their foes, but to forcibly 'enlist them as foot soldiers. They are little more than cannon fodder, if truth be told - fed, clothed, and armed with the most meager essentials.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Once they were rebels; slaves fighting to shake off the chains of the Capitaran arenas. Now they are an army - brave and determined soldiers with a country of their own to defend. Yet by training and nature Tarthans remain gladiators - used to fighting alone, or in small groups. They will strike quickly, and retreat, never allowing themselves to get bogged down in a long, drawn-out conflict. Their commanders drill them constantly on all types of terrain, so that in combat they may move as quickly in swamp as on packed earth.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Once they were rebels; slaves fighting to shake off the chains of the Capitaran arenas. Now they are an army - brave and determined soldiers with a country of their own to defend. Yet by training and nature Tarthans remain gladiators - used to fighting alone, or in small groups. They will strike quickly, and retreat, never allowing themselves to get bogged down in a long, drawn-out conflict. Their commanders drill them constantly on all types of terrain, so that in combat they may move as quickly in swamp as on packed earth.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: These are Elemental's most fearsome warriors; bred for battle, taught to strike without mercy and to ignore pain, to banish the words 'caution' and 'surrender' from their vocabulary. Whether you engage them in single combat, or fight them in phalanxes, you will learn the truth of those words attributed to Iskahar, last of Ereog's line, as he lay dying on the steppes of Engar. 'It is no shame to perish to a superior foe."

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: These are Elemental's most fearsome warriors; bred for battle, taught to strike without mercy and to ignore pain, to banish the words 'caution' and 'surrender' from their vocabulary. Whether you engage them in single combat, or fight them in phalanxes, you will learn the truth of those words attributed to Iskahar, last of Ereog's line, as he lay dying on the steppes of Engar. 'It is no shame to perish to a superior foe."

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: For a thousand years, following their banishment from Imperium, the Urxen roamed the great Umbran wastes. There, in the shadow of the mountain ranges ruled by the Titan Ilosa, she who became the Lady Umber, they forged a special relationship with the creatures of Elemental, a bond that not even the Cataclysm could break. Even now, the Urxen can call to their cause the great serpents of this world - the naja and the ophidian - and command them in battle.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: For a thousand years, following their banishment from Imperium, the Urxen roamed the great Umbran wastes. There, in the shadow of the mountain ranges ruled by the Titan Ilosa, she who became the Lady Umber, they forged a special relationship with the creatures of Elemental, a bond that not even the Cataclysm could break. Even now, the Urxen can call to their cause the great serpents of this world - the naja and the ophidian - and command them in battle.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Resoln is a new country - but its fighters draw their strength from the old powers, from the magics of the Dread Lord Curgen, most powerful of all the Titans to ever walk upon Elemental. The armies of Resoln discount the use of much equipment the typical soldier relies upon, and instead make use of the enchantments, spells, and creatures that are their birthright.

UnitType.Description: A peasant with a stick.
UnitType.Backstory: Resoln is a new country - but its fighters draw their strength from the old powers, from the magics of the Dread Lord Curgen, most powerful of all the Titans to ever walk upon Elemental. The armies of Resoln discount the use of much equipment the typical soldier relies upon, and instead make use of the enchantments, spells, and creatures that are their birthright.

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
Defenders are formidable troops that are able to outlast enemy units and absorb lots of damage.
A spearman is effective against well armored enemies.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
+0.5 Faction Prestige per Level

UnitType.Backstory: Relias was orphaned when his clan's camp was set ablaze by wandering thieves. Finding a new home with a caring scholar, Relias focused his attention on the books that surrounded him. Those stories sent his mind racing between dreams of heroism and the harsh reality of the sword.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You were born the pampered son of a noble; the first two dozen years of your life, you wasted in the city of New Pariden, drinking, gaming, whoring, running through every last bit of the fortune your parents bequeathed you before being conscripted into the service of Queen Procipinee. At her command, you journeyed East, into the lands of the Fallen, where you learned first-hand the power of the Channelers that rule that dark and devastated continent.
You know that power will not rest until all of Elemental is subjugated to its will. The power of the West must join together to confront that evil; you are determined to lead them in that fight.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
+0.5 Faction Prestige per Level

UnitType.Backstory: In the Temple of Destiny, in the center of once-great Cyndrum, the Oracle Ceresa can be found, wisest amongst the Fallen. She speaks for the last of the titans, the Dread Lord Talax. The oracle performs magics of the highest difficulty and pronounces prophecies for her people and those who seek her council.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You were born long ago, in the north of Anthys, a simple child, of simple people. But the gods blessed you with a gift - the ability to foretell the future. It was a blessing you neither asked for, nor desired. It took you from your home, to Odenvell, where warlords and statesmen, mages and masters-at-arms alike, came to the Temple raised in your honor bowing down before you, asking for your favor. But you shunned the power you had been given, and sought only solitude.
Now you seek more. The world has changed, and you have changed with it. Power, you see now, is your birthright - your heritage - your destiny. You will use it to restore order to the world's chaos... and raise an Empire that will last a thousand years.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
+0.5 Faction Prestige per Level

UnitType.Backstory: This warrior-queen is the only child of the great Gladiator Tarth, for whom the country she now leads was named. Irane is, in many ways, her father's physical twin. She has the same features and is, in full armor, virtually the same size. Her entire life was spent living in his shadow; his presence, and absence, shaped her every action.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
Your father was Tarth the Valiant, who led the gladiators' rebellion that freed the slaves of the north. From the time you were old enough to hold a sword, you stood at his right hand in his war councils, and rode at his side into battle.
Now Tarth is dead - and the mantle of leadership, you feel, should pass to you. But many of those who followed him have so far been reluctant to raise your banners. They ignore your fighting skills - and the channeler's abilities you have only recently developed.
This you are determined to change. For as your youth belies your years of experience in battle, your fragile appearance belies your inner steel.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
+0.5 Faction Prestige per Level

UnitType.Backstory: Karavox claims linneage from Warlord Kraxis, slayer of Emperor Amarian. None are certain of which race, man or Fallen, he was truly born. What is certain is that he is no ordinary being, but rather a channeler of surpassing abilities. With his magics he razed the great palace at Goyarh Hedigah, such is his might.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
Men of the West call you a traitor. They say you have betrayed the principles of mankind - nobility, honor, fairness. They look down upon you with contempt, and say they will never trust the Krax again.
They are fools.
History shows it was the Amarian who abandoned the Krax - who left your armies to stand alone in the East. Your grandfather and father, your friends and neighbors died fighting for the race of man; you are determined not to share their fate. You will forge a new Kraxis, one that stands apart from all others, men and Fallen alike- a civilization destined to be spoken of in the same breath as the kingdoms of Hallas and Malaya, of Al-Ashteroth and fabled Antheros.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
+0.5 Faction Prestige per Level

UnitType.Backstory: Magnar is Fallen, ancient beyond reckoning. He is said to be descended of the first Magnar, who was the first of the Fallen created by the Dread Lord, thousands of years in the past. He rules over the city of Imperium and knows the secrets of the Dread Lord.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You are eldest of all who now walk this world.
You stood at Curgen's side as he raised Imperium to the highest of heights; you watched as the awesome energies of the cataclysm destroyed the great Empire he had created. For a hundred years you have waited, and gathered your strength. You have apprenticed to the Black Sorcerer, and withstood the fires of the Veladrii's forge; you have trained with the commanders of the Quendar, sharpening your already-considerable fighting skills.
Now it is your time. You are ready to raise an Empire of your own; to discipline those savages wreaking havoc upon the land, and restore honor to those tribes who will pay homage to you.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
+0.5 Faction Prestige per Level

UnitType.Backstory: Born in the shadow of the Skarps, raised by miners turned subsistence farmers, Enil Markinn was the catalyst behind the rebirth of the Miners Guild. He was also the first among their number to actively seek out trade for their ore in the cities surrounding Lake Zabril.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You were born into the hardscrabble life of a miner, like your father and grandfather before. By the time you were ten years old, you were digging in the Skarps, in the vast tunnels carved by the Aivernach. At thirty you became leader of your clan; six months later, on an expedition south, you became lost in the jungles of Zad-Zabril.
Your sojourn lasted nearly a decade. In that time you became a master of the channeler's art and saw many wondrous things. The glories of the past were made manifest to you: the bridges of Neshin, the temples of lost Zabril. You are determined to restore those monuments and build ones of your own, in the process writing your name - and the name of your people - in the history books of Elemental.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
+0.5 Faction Prestige per Level

UnitType.Backstory: Daughter of Amarian III, Queen Procipinee of New Pariden remains the greatest channeler of the New Age. Her powers have been instrumental in restoring life to the shattered lands surrounding her capital city, and in keeping that city safe from monsters and wicked men alike.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
You are Procipinee, sole survivor of the royal family that once ruled the Free Cities of the North.
Your father was Amarian III - Amarian the Sojourner. He bequeathed to you not just his abilities as a channeler, but a strong sense of responsibility. It is your duty, you feel, to use your gifts in the service of others, to make the lives of those less fortunate, less gifted than yourself, better. You would restore the Golden Age of the Magi... bring the benefits of that civilization to all of Elemental - including races other than men, if they would accept your leadership.

GameModifier.Provides: -10% Unrest in the city this unit is in
+0.5 Faction Prestige per Level

UnitType.Backstory: Verga is the most fearsome of all Fallen in the East. He stands as a full 10 feet high, and has a hammer with which he can crush an ox's skull with a single blow. His might is prodigious, as is his skill with weaponry. His fighters are trained as well, and obey his orders without question.
UnitType.LorebookIntroText:
Many things are said of you; that your own mother called you monster, and cast you out from your home. That you were raised by wargs in the Asag, and rose to command the pack. Some of those things are true; none of them matter. To you, words are wind. Pretty speeches win no wars. Strength does. Strength of arms, magic and will.
At the age of fifteen, you crossed Kharrazan's Fist in search of the Trog who murdered your brother. For nineteen days, you marched across the desert sands, until you found the killer and his companions. Most you killed with your knife, or their own weapons; the murderer, you ripped apart with your bare hands. The rest follow you now, as all others will soon. None can withstand your power. Those who will not yield will die. Those who survive will serve.

UnitType.Description: Caravans boost your economy by allowing merchants in your cities to trade goods with each other.
Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
UnitType.Backstory: "I seek no mercenaries; the Silver Swordsmen and their ilk are unwelcome in the ranks of my army. What I seek are heroes - those who wish to make bettering this world their life's adventure!" These words - uttered at the nadir of the Nobles Revolt, when the armies of Procipinee surrounded Relias and his companions at the foot of Mount Essa - remain the rallying cry for all Altar's soldiers. This is an army of adventurers - many of whom are famous in their own right for the quests they have completed - an army that will sometimes dare the impossible and often achieve it.

UnitType.Description: The Galadwenn are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance. The claim to trace their ancestry to air spirits and though that is unlikely, their grace is amazing.
UnitType.Backstory: These are the archers of Pariden, Amarians who are masters of the bow, trained in the same manner and using the same drills as the Ninety-Nine of Redstone. And no wonder - for their namesake, Galadwenn of the Free Cities, was himself heir to the Bow of Ydrain, said to have been used by Argynn in his war against the tribes of the Khulan.

All who wear the colors of this army, from commander to common foot-soldier, can trace their lineage back to the great kingdoms of the pre-cataclysmic era - to Coriopolis, Zad-Zabril, and even fabled Antheros. The blood of the channelers of old runs in their veins; they know and are unafraid of using this power to aid them in combat, both as shield and sword, in defense and attack. The commander who would engage this army in battle most possess a similar familiarity with the enchanter's art.

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
UnitType.Backstory: These are miners by trade; they make cautious soldiers, content to assess a battle's progress from a fortified position, to rely less on tactical skill and more on superior equipment to provide them advantage. Many among them are innately resistant to the channeler's basic spells, a trait inherited from the greatest of their kind, Fierann Ma Tua of the Aivernach.

Many among them are innately resistant to the channeler's basic spells, a trait inherited from the greatest of their kind, Fierann Ma Tua of the Aivernach.

Many among them are innately resistant to the channeler's basic spells, a trait inherited from the greatest of their kind, Fierann Ma Tua of the Aivernach.

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
UnitType.Backstory: There are no more stalwart defenders than the armies of Kraxis; their ability to establish and protect near-unassailable battlefield positions is well-documented. Recall the siege of Morrania, the last of the great pre-cataclysmic battles between Man and Fallen, where four hundred Krax held off two thousand D'Rog fighters. Some may call them traitors, but the Krax have an unshakeable belief in the righteousness of their cause, and an uncanny ability to persuade others to their side a trait opposing commanders would do well to take note of.

Recall the siege of Morrania, the last of the great pre-cataclysmic battles between Man and Fallen, where four hundred Krax held off two thousand D'Rog fighters. Some may call them traitors, but the Krax have an unshakeable belief in the righteousness of their cause, and an uncanny ability to persuade others to their side a trait opposing commanders would do well to take note of.

UnitType.Description: Featherwyn Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance. They are as adept in battle as they are at retelling the stories of their heroes.
UnitType.Backstory: The armies of Capitar have at their disposal the vast wealth of the great trading houses of old, money that lets them buy not just the best equipment, but the best fighters: mercenaries such as the Silver Swordsmen; archers whose skills rival the ninety-nine of Redstone; war horses bred from the stock of fabled Antheros. This great wealth buys influence in diplomatic councils as well as on the battlefield; a fact the seasoned commander would do well to keep in mind when forging alliances.

The armies of Capitar have at their disposal the vast wealth of the great trading houses of old, money that lets them buy not just the best equipment, but the best fighters: mercenaries such as the Silver Swordsmen; archers whose skills rival the ninety-nine of Redstone; war horses bred from the stock of fabled Antheros. This great wealth buys influence in diplomatic councils as well as on the battlefield; a fact the seasoned commander would do well to keep in mind when forging alliances.

UnitType.Description: Dross Archers are lightly equipped and count on numbers to kill their opponents. The Quendar believe that a bow makes one an archer, and they are quick to hand them out to untrained units when war requires.
UnitType.Backstory: Ages ago, when the legions of Antheros fell to the Quendar, Magnar II enslaved the soldiers of that once-great nation, forcing them to serve in the advance guard of his army. Since that day, the Quendar have made it a practice to not only enslave the conquered masses of their foes, but to forcibly 'enlist them as foot soldiers. They are little more than cannon fodder, if truth be told - fed, clothed, and armed with the most meager essentials.

Ages ago, when the legions of Antheros fell to the Quendar, Magnar II enslaved the soldiers of that once-great nation, forcing them to serve in the advance guard of his army. Since that day, the Quendar have made it a practice to not only enslave the conquered masses of their foes, but to forcibly 'enlist them as foot soldiers. They are little more than cannon fodder, if truth be told - fed, clothed, and armed with the most meager essentials.

UnitType.Description: The Clan of the Crow are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance. Among the archers of Elemental the Clan is the most reknown for their skill.
UnitType.Backstory: Once they were rebels; slaves fighting to shake off the chains of the Capitaran arenas. Now they are an army - brave and determined soldiers with a country of their own to defend. Yet by training and nature Tarthans remain gladiators - used to fighting alone, or in small groups. They will strike quickly, and retreat, never allowing themselves to get bogged down in a long, drawn-out conflict. Their commanders drill them constantly on all types of terrain, so that in combat they may move as quickly in swamp as on packed earth.

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
UnitType.Backstory: These are Elemental's most fearsome warriors; bred for battle, taught to strike without mercy and to ignore pain, to banish the words 'caution' and 'surrender' from their vocabulary. Whether you engage them in single combat, or fight them in phalanxes, you will learn the truth of those words attributed to Iskahar, last of Ereog's line, as he lay dying on the steppes of Engar. 'It is no shame to perish to a superior foe."

Whether you engage them in single combat, or fight them in phalanxes, you will learn the truth of those words attributed to Iskahar, last of Ereog's line, as he lay dying on the steppes of Engar. 'It is no shame to perish to a superior foe."

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
UnitType.Backstory: For a thousand years, following their banishment from Imperium, the Urxen roamed the great Umbran wastes. There, in the shadow of the mountain ranges ruled by the Titan Ilosa, she who became the Lady Umber, they forged a special relationship with the creatures of Elemental, a bond that not even the Cataclysm could break. Even now, the Urxen can call to their cause the great serpents of this world - the naja and the ophidian - and command them in battle.

Even now, the Urxen can call to their cause the great serpents of this world - the naja and the ophidian - and command them in battle.

UnitType.Description: Archers are lightly equipped and skilled at picking off their opponents at a distance.
UnitType.Backstory: Resoln is a new country - but its fighters draw their strength from the old powers, from the magics of the Dread Lord Curgen, most powerful of all the Titans to ever walk upon Elemental. The armies of Resoln discount the use of much equipment the typical soldier relies upon, and instead make use of the enchantments, spells, and creatures that are their birthright.

The armies of Resoln discount the use of much equipment the typical soldier relies upon, and instead make use of the enchantments, spells, and creatures that are their birthright.

Within the catacombs of ruined Odenvell, Ceresa took dozens of these carnivorous spiders and bound them to her will. Study of the proper enchantments will enable those who are flesh of her flesh - those who the world calls Wraiths - to similarly enslave these deadly arachnids, and use them as weapons against their enemies.
